questions.name: Use case type records to establish the parent child relationships.
A case that does not have a parent case, but can cover, or become a parent of, other cases.

A case that is covered by a parent case. When you configure a case as a child case, Pega maintains a relationship between the parent and child cases. Child cases represent work that must be completed to resolve the parent.
Which statements are correct related to multiple child case for a parent case?

options.answer: A parent case creating multiple child cases allows for work to be processed in parallel.
Each child case can be handled by different parties with different expertise.
When processing child cases in parallel, the parent case may need to wait until a child case is complete before the parent case can be resolved.

questions.name: Implementing a business process in a separate case type also allows you to reuse the case type as needed. For example, claims for both automobile and property insurance may involve a bodily injury claim.
Which statements are true related to wait shape?

options.answer: You can enforce dependencies between parent and child cases with the Wait step.
When a parent case reaches the Wait step, the case pauses until the dependency resolves.
Once the dependency resolves, the case resumes processing.

questions.name: The Wait step enforces the following types of dependencies:

options.answer: Pausing a case until another case (or all cases) reach a specified status
Can only be implemented in flow/case life cycle
Pausing a case until a predetermined time expires

questions.name: You are only able to define a single status for the Wait step to check. If you encounter a situation where you need to check multiple statuses, consult the Wait Shape for mid process dependency.
The ability to set the Wait step as a timer is only available in Designer Studio.
With an accident claim, you may give someone 24 hours to upload pictures for the accident. You would want to pause the case until the wait time has elapsed.

options.answer: This can be configured from designer studio
This can be configured from pega express
This can be configured from pega express as well as designer studio.

questions.name: Case Designer, click + STEP > ... More Utilities > Create Case > Select to add a Create Case step to the Case life cycle.
Designer Studio gives you one additional option to create a case as a top level case instead of a child case.
You can configure a case to wait for a set amount of time or until a subcase reaches a defined status.
Which requirement is best implemented using a Wait step in a case?

options.answer: You need to send an email after a user completes a form.
You need to pause a case until a user uploads a signed document.
You cannot complete a purchase case on a website unless you complete a new account child case.
You cannot proceed in an expense report until a manager approves the request.

questions.name: In an mortgage application, the user creates a loan request. In order for the loan request to be approved, the loan officer must receive the results of an appraisal. How would you configure the case types to reflect their relationship?

options.answer: Make mortgage a parent case type. Make loan request and appraisal child case types.
Make appraisal a parent case type, and loan request a child case type.
Make both loan request and appraisal peer case types.
Make loan request a parent case type, and appraisal a child case type.

questions.name: In an online shopping application, the primary case type PurchaseOrder has two child case types: Payment and Packaging. In processing PurchaseOrder case PO-100,  Payment case PayMnt-30 and Packaging case Pack-16 are created. Which statement about the processing of PO-100, PayMnt-30, and Pack-16 is correct?

options.answer: Both PayMnt-30 and Pack-16 have to be resolved before PO-100 can be resolved.
PO-100 has to be resolved before either PayMnt-30 and Pack-16 is resolved.
PO-100 can be resolved when either PayMnt-30 or Pack-16 is resolved.
Pack-16 has to be resolved before PayMnt-30 is resolved.
